div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 104 Candia (Herakleion), Crete, c. 1914 Burial: 4th cent. B.C. (T) Contents: 3+ AR Cnossus: 1 st. (as BMC 3, same obv. die) Cydonia (?): 1 st. (as Svoronos pl. 9, 1) Lyttus: 1 st. Disposition: J. S. Cameron Hill, Essays in Aegean Archaeology . . . Evans (Oxford, 1927), p. 43, no. 4 (mentions the Cydonia coin) Letter from E. J. P. Raven, 1938
